item.title: Ip banning
item.dc:creator: @mr13 mr.
item.description:
@mr13 wrote:

kk…

go to logs, then right click somewhere and look for new…put your cursor over it and find where it says text document. click on it and new txt document will appear rename it to ipbanlogs.

and when you use “::ipban” it will put your name and the ipbanned persons name in that file

and thats what thats all about

Read full topic

item.title: Ip banning
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

that wont work if you just add it in and do nothing…
and try explaining to him what it does.

bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));

just to tell you the server cant load that if it doesnt exist and its gonna give him a error. so yeah easy to get this work if you give it some thought.
most servers like the old ones use data/bannedips

Read full topic

item.title: Ip banning
item.dc:creator: @mr13 mr.
item.description:
@mr13 wrote:

}
if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“yournamehere”))
{
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];
appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
v.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(“player successfully ip banned”);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
}
  }

try it
